message.say: I really like happy endings!

message.say: I also liked that first story.

message.say: Yes I definitely would.

message.name: B15
message.say: , this has been fun. I hope you would also read another story with me.

message.name: B16
message.say: Interesting, I don't think I've heard of it.

message.name: B17
message.say: Who would try to marry somebody by having to answer three riddles or die?

message.name: B18
message.say: And would the parents ever ask the suitors to answer three riddles or kill them?

message.name: B19
message.say: That is smarter move!

message.name: B20
message.say: That was right on time! It would really be too awkward for Viola to tell the truth.

message.name: B21
message.say: So the princess chose to stay a human, it seems.

message.name: B22
message.say: And she doesn't seem to be comfortable with that.

message.name: B23
message.say: Yeah good point Cristina, I hadn't thought about that. I honestly don't know.

message.name: B24
message.say: Ah I see Cristina. It's sort of like living life and you haven't matured enough to know exactly what you want in life.

message.name: B25
message.say: Cristina, I noticed that the princess at the end did not tell the Evening Star to shine over her life, but over her good fortunes.

message.name: B26
message.say: This is a sad story, Cristina.

message.name: B27
message.say: It kinda sucks how in this story the prince not only has to pursue her, but even at the very end where he won her fair and square, he still put his life in her hands.

message.name: B28
message.say: Sometimes I do wonder what the world would be like if everybody believed in unconditional love.

message.name: B29
message.say: I'm glad that this story got a happy ending!

message.name: B30
message.say: These riddles that Turandot asks are ridiculous. I don't think I would ever be able to get the right answer.

message.name: B31
message.say: Thanks Cristina. I would have to think some more about it.

message.name: B32
message.say: Ah I get it. Because fairy tales usually involve magic, which does not follow the law of nature.

message.name: B33
message.say: Do we have another story? I'm really enjoying these!

message.name: B34
message.say: Do we have another story? I'm really enjoying these!

message.name: B35
message.say: This is a really nice imagery. The princess asked for the star to fall for her and he did.

message.name: B36
message.say: I see, thanks Cristina, I'll keep a watch out for this metaphor when I read future stories.

message.name: B37
message.say: The princess asked a pretty big thing of the Evening Star

message.name: B38
message.say: That is true.

message.name: B39
message.say: The Prince of Tartary is very brave.

message.name: B40
message.say: I guess this would be another literary device in order to represent an ideal or theme.

message.name: B41
message.say: I really like happy endings!

message.name: B42
message.say: I really like that first story.

message.name: B43
message.say: Yes I definitely would.

message.name: B44
message.say: , this has been fun. I hope you would also read another story with me.

message.name: B45
message.say: Romanian? How exotic!

message.name: B46
message.say: I still feel like the duke should've at least suspected her true gender. I mean, Viola has been with him all this time, how could he not know?

message.name: B47
message.say: Really? like what, Cristina?

message.name: B48
message.say: I see, that's kind of beautiful I guess.

message.name: B49
message.say: , I really enjoyed reading these two stories with you. I hoped you enjoyed them also.

message.name: B50
message.say: I'm gonna go to the library right now! thanks so much Cristina, and you also,

message.name: B51
message.say: So describing the evening star as being "dead" isn't really that he is dead? Since technically the evening star really lives forever. I'm kind of confused here.

message.name: B52
message.say: Thanks Cristina, I would need to think more about it.

message.name: B53
message.say: Wow, exercise in summarization really helped me check my comprehension of the story.

message.name: B54
message.say: I really like how the Creator said that each living thing only lives because it dies.

message.name: B55
message.say: It's a very interesting perspective.

message.name: B56
message.say: I like how the prince is giving Turandot a taste of her own medicine. He really is smart.

message.name: B57
message.say: Yes but now she's torturing an innocent person for it, I really don't like her.

message.name: B58
message.say: I see Cristina. Thanks

message.name: B59
message.say: I love to read short stories! They tell most fascinating things.

message.name: B60
message.say: Two? Oh boy I cannot wait. But Cristina, I might have some trouble comprehending some parts.

message.name: B61
message.say: Oh I'm so excited.

message.name: B62
message.say: , I hope you will read them with me.
